results.content: I learned a lot about CSS grids, react, router, and styled-components, there were some parts towards the end where it felt like the edits were choppy or sometimes a code was fixed after a jump, but I was able to reference the downloaded complete version to compare codes to see where I went wrong, other than that, I enjoyed the course, thank you

results.content: Concise, potent, to the point, got me from A to B in very little time. This course is for an intermediate with an immediate use case. Be familiar with React and CSS. Worth the money.
results.content_html: Concise, potent, to the point, got me from A to B in very little time. This course is for an intermediate with an immediate use case. Be familiar with React and CSS. Worth the money.

results.content:
Overall, I'd say I enjoyed the course. It's fast paced and it was the first time I really used styled components in a project. This is not  a beginners React course as it jumps right into building the Pinstagram clone (after the CSS grid intro section). If you're new to React, definitely look elsewhere for an in-depth React Starter course. 

A few things can be improved, like video editing. The instructor is already aware that the audio is inconsistent, and I also found that certain lessons jumped around too much with its edits/cuts, making it a bit hard to follow along. 

Looking forward to starting react.school's Build a Cryptocurrency course, which I already purchased.

results.content:
Sound quality is VERY varied - sometimes sound is very low, and next it is very high, a bit frustrating, but it is copeable…

One caveat - the sudden jump from section 'Photogrid' (19) to 'Google Fonts' (20) is confusing - suddenly you are working in code, that doesn't match the students...definately a turnoff

Teacher is VERY good though - nothing to 'nag' about there.

results.content: I really liked this course. Considering it is tough to find a React + CSS Grid tutorial together, I think this is a decent course. There were a few quirks with the teaching style and pace that was a small frustration. But considering there is no other competition for this, and how he covered the foundations so well, I'm happy.

response.content: Hi Lawrence! Thanks so much for the feedback. We wanted to create a unique experience with some fairly new and different technology around React and mobile responsiveness. Glad you enjoyed the process and appreciate your feedback. We're always looking to improve, so message us anytime.

results.content:
This course has done a good job getting me started with styled components and grid so it did that part really well. The instructor is clearly on top of his game. 

However, sometimes the explanations are not entirely clear (aren't you mixing up columns and rows/children sometimes when explaining the cascade layout?) . Also, this is quite a steep learning curve for someone just learning React. 

The boilerplate you use from the React Router website has since been updated, it looks different now. I had to manually start typing up that original code from the article you posted in the beginning. The final code in the resources folder is exactly that: final. So I can't really go back to the starting point unless I manually type up the starting boilerplate, which is tedious. I wish I had had a better code-along experience. 

I guess I will watch this again in 2 months when I am more advanced to collect the full wisdom that's in there! 

The uneven sound levels did not bother me at all, it's not significant. If you correct anything, add the starting boilerplate code to the resources library next to the final code.

Thanks for your work, I hope this feedback helps with future courses.

Adam

response.content: Hey Adam, this is amazing feedback. We will absolutely take your suggestions into account.
response.content_html: Hey Adam, this is amazing feedback. We will absolutely take your suggestions into account.

results.content: this is a coarse to teach styled components and grid.  Don't take this expecting to lear React.  Everything is hard coded.  I was kind of disappointed because i thought  we would be learning how to dynamically create the content but if your goal is just to learn grid and styled components it could be a good option.

I was kind of disappointed because i thought we would be learning how to dynamically create the content but if your goal is just to learn grid and styled components it could be a good option.

results.content: This was definitely a fun course.  Instructor explained steps very well and the course content delivered as promised.  I would haven given 5 stars had a few of the videos been edited a little better for continuity.  Do not worry, if you pay attention you will not get lost.  Only a few minor blips.  I would recommend this course to anyone wanting to gain experience in both CSS Grid Layouts and styled-components.

results.content:
This course delivers on what the title promises.
An explanation on combining react with css grid (and styled components). 
A great course for people who already know the basics of react. This should not be your first react tutorial.

results.content: A lot of great insights.  A bit sloppy in the production of it at times.
results.content_html: A lot of great insights. A bit sloppy in the production of it at times.

results.content: This is a good course for learning Grid CSS but it is a poor course for learning React.

response.content:
Hey William, as the Instructor who created this course, I'd like to thank you for your review. The purpose of the course was to help students learn and master CSS Grid, and showcase using it in the context of a React app. There is a prerequisite that we tried to clarify, which stated that students should have basic knowledge of React prior to the course. We figured that if we spent time teaching students what React is, that might turn other students off who already know React. We did teach a bit of React Router, but it's possible we could have gone into more detail there. You are not the first person to point this out with our courses, which are designed to be professional React projects, and we are still tackling the challenge of students who are expecting a full crash course intro on React.

I want to make sure this course is the best experience for you, so I'd love if you sent us a message and clarified what else you'd like to get out of this course. Our lectures are always updating and expanding, to meet as many students needs as possible. If you would have preferred an hour or so introduction to React or React Router, or showcasing more features in the app, that's something we can definitely do, and soon. We hope to hear back from you, as a reminder you can always change your review, and we'd like to thank you again for your feedback.
response.content_html:

The purpose of the course was to help students learn and master CSS Grid, and showcase using it in the context of a React app. There is a prerequisite that we tried to clarify, which stated that students should have basic knowledge of React prior to the course. We figured that if we spent time teaching students what React is, that might turn other students off who already know React. We did teach a bit of React Router, but it's possible we could have gone into more detail there. You are not the first person to point this out with our courses, which are designed to be professional React projects, and we are still tackling the challenge of students who are expecting a full crash course intro on React.

I want to make sure this course is the best experience for you, so I'd love if you sent us a message and clarified what else you'd like to get out of this course. Our lectures are always updating and expanding, to meet as many students needs as possible. If you would have preferred an hour or so introduction to React or React Router, or showcasing more features in the app, that's something we can definitely do, and soon. We hope to hear back from you, as a reminder you can always change your review, and we'd like to thank you again for your feedback.
